definitions.text: an aircraft that has a fixed wing and is powered by propellers or jets
examples: the flight was delayed due to trouble with the airplane
we will refer to the plane of the graph as the X-Y plane
any line joining two points on a plane lies wholly on that plane

definitions.text: a level of existence or development
examples: he lived on a worldly plane

definitions.text: a power tool for smoothing or shaping wood
a carpenter's hand tool with an adjustable blade for smoothing or shaping wood
examples: the cabinetmaker used a plane for the finish work

definitions.text: cut or remove with or as if with a plane
examples: The machine shaved off fine layers from the piece of wood

definitions.text: travel on the surface of water
make even or smooth, with or as with a carpenter's plane
examples: plane the top of the door

definitions.text: having a surface without slope, tilt in which no part is higher or lower than another
examples: skirts sewn with fine flat seams
